result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell Dean Taylor Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid thru Probation. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.
$1,352.00 to be paid to DOC.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid through DOC.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must follow rules of extended supervision.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

supervisions.notes: May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

18CF128-w/h, probation 3 yrs, concurrent with other time serving.  Follow rules of supervision. 20 days credit.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge.  Payable during supervision thru COCC.  FTP-judgment.
